intro: Rhinanthus borbasii subsp. songaricus, commonly known as the Songaric yellow rattle, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, characterized by its hemiparasitic nature, meaning it partially relies on host plants for nutrients. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats like grasslands and steppe environments. Its subspecific classification highlights its distinct ecological and morphological traits compared to other members of the Rhinanthus genus.
